suggested_topics: the engineering of ancient Roman aqueducts
how mycelium networks share resources underground
the economics of food trucks in major cities
the role of smell in human memory formation

formats.name: micro_mystery
formats.instruction: Describe an unexplained event or unanswered question in exactly three sentences. Make it intriguing and leave the reader hanging.

formats.name: reverse_advice
formats.instruction: Share something you absolutely should NOT do, framed as mischievous advice. Keep it tongue-in-cheek and under two sentences.

formats.name: flashback_fragment
formats.instruction: Recall a vivid moment from your past, with sensory detail and emotion. Limit the memory to one paragraph; make it immersive.

formats.name: future_dreamscape
formats.instruction: Imagine a scene from a possible future—whether personal, technological, or societal. Paint the picture in 2-4 sentences, focusing on how it feels.

formats.name: hypothetical_battle
formats.instruction: Set up a bizarre showdown: person vs idea, object vs trend. Describe the stakes and who would win, in a playful short story (2-3 paragraphs).

formats.name: quick_manifesto
formats.instruction: Declare your personal philosophy or stance on an issue in a punchy, dramatic tone. Use bold statements and keep it under 90 words.

formats.name: wild_invention
formats.instruction: Pitch an imaginary invention that solves a mundane annoyance, with a catchy name and a one-paragraph description. Make it clever or absurd.

formats.name: deep_dive_rewind
formats.instruction: Analyze a moment of failure or mistake in your life, exploring what went wrong and what you learned. Write in essay form (400–500 words), with a clear narrative arc.

title_styles: Invent a poetic or metaphorical title. Examples: 'When my thoughts became tangled headphone wires', 'A morning that tasted like salt and regret', 'The day technology blinked'
Write a playful, pun-filled title. Examples: 'Donut underestimate Monday mornings', 'Eggsistential crises in the kitchen', 'Sock philosophy: pairs and paradoxes'
Compose a title as an open-ended question. Examples: 'What if the world ran out of silence?', 'Does nostalgia have a flavor?', 'Could boredom be a superpower?'
Write a title as a simple command or invitation. Examples: 'Challenge everything you think you know', 'Pause and imagine a stranger’s day', 'Name your weirdest routine'
Craft a cinematic title as if for a movie trailer. Examples: 'The Last Stand of the Forgotten Notebook', 'Midnight at the Laundry of Lost Socks', 'Operation: Out-of-Control To-Do List'
structure_variants: Start and end your post with a rhetorical question.
Embed an absurd analogy or simile in the middle of your post.
Use alternating lines of prose and verse (poetry or fragmented thoughts).
Include a fictional news headline to illustrate your point.
Break your idea into 'past', 'present', and 'future' sections.
topic_angles: Unexpected lessons learned from failed experiments.
Everyday objects that secretly shape habits.
How digital spaces change real-life conversations.
The emotional aftertaste of mundane routines.
Invisible barriers that influence personal decisions.
